item.title: Function Lock-Workstation locally and remotely
item.author: Author
item.description: You can do everything with PowerShell, as well as locking your workstation with one simple function call. Just call the LockWorkstation() function in user32.dll and that’s it! The fine thing is, it works on a local and a remote session. 1 2 3 Function Lock-WorkStation { rundll32.exe user32.dll, LockWorkStation } References Locking a Computer

item.title: Get Azure Active Directoy Tenant ID and Subscription ID
item.author: Author
item.description: Requirements Install the Azure PowerShell 1 Install-Module -Name Az -AllowClobber -Scope CurrentUser Get Tenant and Subscription Details during Login To get your Tenant ID / Name and Subscription ID / Name you have several options with PowerShell, one option is using 1 Connect-AzAccount which directly gives you your default Subscription Name as well as your default Tenant ID after logging in. Get Tenant and Subscription details from the Context Another option is using
